data.title: Say How? - National Library Service for the Blind and Print Disabled (NLS)
data.meta_description: A Pronunciation Guide to Names of Public Figures Updated May 2024 Last name starts with . . . Key to pronunciation (Note: Stressed syllables are in UPPER CASE.) Ā, ā = able, rate Ä, ä = father, wand A, a = pat, marry Â, â = air, prepare Ē, ē = evil, reel E, e
data.meta_site_name: National Library Service for the Blind and Print Disabled (NLS) | Library of Congress
data.text:
Ā, ā = able, rate

Ä, ä = father, wand

A, a = pat, marry

Â, â = air, prepare

Ē, ē = evil, reel

E, e = end, edit

Ī, ī = ice, ride

I, i = in, blister

Ō, ō = over, roll

O, o = on, rob

Ô, ô = off, audit

OO, oo = spoon, ooze

Ü, ü = book, foot

U, u = under, but

Û, û = urge, burn

YOO, yoo = unify, beauty

ə = affair, sofa (general "shwa" sound)

CH = chair, bleach
